name: Northumbria
startIntroPart1: King Eadwine of Northumbria, the first Christian king of Northumbria and a crucial role in the early Christianization of England. Your reign united the kingdom of Bernicia and Deira which then sparked a period of expansion and consolidation of Northumbrian power. Oh, King Edwin, can you once again unite the divided nations of the world? Can you create great prosperity once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your land will be put into good use, do not worry!
attacked: You stand no chance against us, fool!
defeated: I have been defeated, my kingdom is yours.
introduction: Have you heard of our lord and savior Jesus Christ?
hateHello: What the hell do you want?
tradeRequest: Northumbria requires your support, but you will be repaid for it.
uniques: [+2 Faith, +2 Culture] <in cities following our religion>
Free [Great General] appears <after founding a religion>

name: Mercia
startIntroPart1: King Offa of Mercia. You consolidated your control of Midland peoples. Taking advantage of instability in the kingdom of Kent to establish yourself as overlord. In the 780s you extended Mercian Supremacy over most of southern England and regained complete control of the southeast. Oh, King Offa, can you once again unite the divided nations of the world? Can you expand your nation's domination once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
introduction: I am King of the Mercians, and you are?
tradeRequest: If you do not wish to be vanquished, I suggest you accept this trade.
uniques: [+1 Gold, +1 Culture] from each Trade Route
[+1 Production] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Wessex
startIntroPart1: King Alfred of Wessex. You spent several years fighting Viking invasions, winning a decisive victory in the Battle of Edington and made an agreement with the Vikings, dividing England between Anglo-Saxon territory and the Viking-ruled Danelaw. You defended his kingdom against the Viking attempt at conquest, becoming the dominant ruler in England. Oh, Alfred, can you once again defend against foreign invaders? Can you once again become the dominant force? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
attacked: Who do you think you are?!
introduction: I am Alfred the Great, the king of Wessex.
tradeRequest: We offer you this kind trade.

name: East Anglia
startIntroPart1: King Edmund of East Anglia. The Danelaw tried to erase your name from existance, but you prevailed, resisting the Viking forces till your death, turning you into a martyr which earned the respect of many Christians during that time. Oh, Edmund the Martyr, can you take revenge on the vikings who ravaged your name? Can you then unite the great kingdom of England? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
attacked: I will not let it happen again!
introduction: I am King Edmund of East Anglia, I hope we become friends or better.
tradeRequest: I love trading, it helps everyone!
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production] from each Trade Route

name: Sussex
startIntroPart1: Aelle of Sussex. You and three of your sons are said to have landed at a place called Cymensora and fought against the local Britons, resulting a victory in 491. You conquered many lands from the Britons, eventually forging your own petty kingdom of Sussex. Oh Aelle, can you wage war on your enemies and win? Can you conquer more land than you originally did? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
introduction: I am Aelle, and I claim this land for Sussex!
tradeRequest: It appears you have things I don't, how about we peacefully change that?
uniques: [+1 Culture, +1 Production] [in all cities] <starting from the [Classical era]>
[+1 Food] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>
